body:
This seems to be the same underlying issue with https://github.com/loadimpact/k6/issues/702.

> currently we just get the current function, file and line (which often seems to be wrong?)

The error message is display, `baz at baz` comes from `throw new Error("baz");`. Though I agree that the line number seems wrong.

issue.title: Fix duplicated error messages

repository.name: k6
repository.description: A modern load testing tool, using Go and JavaScript

license.name: GNU Affero General Public License v3.0

issue.body:
If RootCmd.Execute returns any error, we always log that error. So
removing log from child command before returning to prevent duplicated
error message printed.

This PR also adds Hint field to ExitCode, to provide hint/details for
the underlying error. It helps the logger keep the semantic and provide
meaningful error message to user.

Updates #994
Fixes #702

body:
The good stacktrace is now produced by this lines https://github.com/loadimpact/k6/blob/8f4797d2761560fefb3e01c1bf440ee6a1c55548/lib/executor/helpers.go#L98-L107 Which basically check "badly" that something is goja.Exception.

I would argue that so that we don't get goja in `lib/...` even more we have another error type that the runner wrap ~errors~ exceptions in before returning them as otherwise we just hope that whatever we get and has String is actually goja.Exception ... https://github.com/dop251/goja/blob/e21ccf39bfce/runtime.go#L301

labels.name: evaluation needed
labels.description: proposal needs to be validated or tested before fully implementing it in k6
